Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Nisin H (natural AMPs; lantibiotic, class 1 bacteriocin, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; UCSS1b; Variant: nisin H F1H)
Sequence Information.Source: Streptococcus hyointestinalisDPC6484, isolated from the porcine intestine: pig microbiota:gut

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: purifed chromatographically (e.g., ion exchange and HPLC) from a bacteria strain isolated from porcine intestine.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (85.29%) toNisin AC: 15%: T: 18%; S: 12%. Differing from nisin A at five positions: Ile1Phe, Leu6Met, Gly18Dhb (threonine dehydrated to dehydrobutyrine), Met21Tyr, and His31Lys.Activity: inhibition zone (area cm2): active against B. cereus 9139 (1.03 cm2), L. delbrueckii subsp. bulgaricus LMG6901 (16.64 cm2), L. actis subsp. cremoris HP (6.52 cm2), E. faecalis 6307 (3,94 cm2), S. agalactiae ATCC 13813 or DPC5338 (2.56-2.66 cm2), S. bovis DPC6491 (1.75 cm2), S. gallolyticus DPC6501 (3.94 cm2), L. innocua DPC3572 (1.5 cm2), L. monocytogenes 1042 (1.58 cm2), S. aureus ATCC 25923 or DPC5245 (2.76-4.78 cm2), L. lactis NZ9700 (0.69 cm2), S. hyointestinalis DPC6484 (0.32 cm2), and S. uberis strain 42 (2.38 cm2). MIC values against  S. aureus ATCC 29213 MSSA or MRSA (MIC 0.19-0.78 uM), E. faecalis ATCC 29212 or 51299 VRE (MIC 1.56 uM), E. faecium ATCC 35667 or  700221 VRE (MIC 0.39 uM) anti-VRE, and B. subtilis 168 (MIC 0.1 uM) (Reiners et al., 2020).Antivirus: Nisin was found to interact with the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein receptor human ACE2 (Bhattacharya et al., 2021).SAR: a change of F1 to I led to a variant with similar activity spectrum (ref 2020. Updated 6/2023; 2/2024
Literature Information.Author: O'Connor PM, O'Shea EF, Guinane CM, O'Sullivan O, Cotter PD, Ross RP, Hill C. 2015
Literature Information.Title: Nisin H Is a New Nisin Variant Produced by the Gut-Derived Strain Streptococcus hyointestinalis DPC6484.
